snippet: The Obama administration says that many people had failed to pay their share of premiums, leaving enrollment at 10.2 million people.
abstract: Obama administration reveals that around 13 percent of people who signed up for health insurance coverage under Affordable Care Act in 2015 have fallen off rolls, primarily because they failed to pay their premiums.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says that many people had failed to pay their share of premiums, leaving enrollment at 10.2 million people.

headline.main: 13% Left Health Care Rolls, U.S. Finds
headline.print_headline: 13% Left Health Care Rolls, U.S. Finds

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
